info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 5:03PM EDT until May 09 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL GREENVILLE AND WEST CENTRAL SPARTANBURG COUNTIES... At 503 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles east of Greenville Downtown, or near Greenville Eastside, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, Mauldin, Taylors, Five Forks, Cherrydale Point, GSP Airport, Paris Mountain State Park, Simpsonville and Greer. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Brief damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines over small areas. A brief period of large hail is also possible. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
